title: 8 Essential Figma Tips Empower Designers to Build Scalable Branded Templates in Buzz

paragraphs.content: Figma's official blog details **8 tips for designers building branded templates in Figma Buzz**, focusing on responsive design and modularity to help marketers create on-brand assets at scale without violating guidelines.These tips emphasize using auto layout for flexibility, separating text layers for bulk creation via CSV imports, and leveraging component variants from design systems.Buzz, launched in open beta, connects templates to team libraries for easy customization like layout swaps and toggles.

paragraphs.content: The guide urges designers to adopt a marketing lens, crafting self-serve templates that "bend—but don't break" brand integrity for assets like social posts and event materials.Updates include video trimming, plugins for asset management, and Unsplash integration to streamline workflows.This enables non-designers via the new Content Seat to produce consistent outputs efficiently.

sections.title: Core Strategies for Flexible Template Design in Buzz

paragraphs.content: Designers should use **auto layout** to ensure consistent spacing in buttons and text boxes, automatically adjusting for content like long headlines to avoid misalignment.Separate text layers for unique inputs, renaming them descriptively such as “Event Title” or “CTA Button Text” with examples like “Date of Event (e.g. July 10, 2025),” supports Bulk Create from CSV/XLSX files.Leverage component variants for logos and icons, allowing swaps via dropdowns in the Change Layout panel without manual edits.

paragraphs.content: Lock brand elements like logos while leaving body text and images unlocked to balance consistency and flexibility in templates.Test assets with realistic content to accommodate varying text lengths and image types before publishing.Publish with clear names, descriptions, and thumbnails for easy discovery in Buzz's grid view and team sections.

sections.title: Configurable Templates and Team Collaboration Boosts

paragraphs.content: Copy component sets from Figma Design into Buzz to enable property-based toggles for layouts, colors, and CTAs suited to platforms like Instagram or LinkedIn.Organize files with logical row groupings and searchable titles for intuitive browsing in the centralized Template/Tools section.Industry experts highlight Buzz's edge over tools like Canva through controlled editing and real-time collaboration for brand assets.

paragraphs.content: Recent Config 2025 updates add breakpoints, grid views, and CMS integration previews to enhance multi-format templates beyond static designs.Community resources like editable style guides provide free foundations for colors, typography, and logos in Buzz setups.These advancements position Buzz as key for 2025 workflows, reducing scratch-building by empowering marketer self-service.
